snippet: Retail sales rose 0.5 percent in December and wholesale inflation dipped 0.2 percent, according to the Commerce Department.
abstract: Commerce Department says that retail sales rose more than expected in December as Americans shrugged off the threat of higher taxes and purchased automobiles and variety of other goods; retail sales rose 0.5 percent in December and wholesale inflation dipped 0.2 percent; sales were up 4.7 percent from December 2011 and up 5.2 percent for the whole of 2012, suggesting momentum in consumer spending as the year ended.
lead_paragraph: Retail sales rose 0.5 percent in December and wholesale inflation dipped 0.2 percent, according to the Commerce Department.

headline.seo: Reports Signal Rising Strength in Consumer Spending
headline.main: Reports Signal Rising Strength in Consumer Spending
headline.print_headline: Reports Signal Rising Strength in Consumer Spending
